channel.title: Tell me wtf is up with my pc!
channel.description:
Everytime i try to run a .exe program to setup something it opens but only to see a few seconds after it opens it just closes by itself. Oh yeah, there was also a problem that kept happening with u tube where i tried watching videos and they start over by themselves. And this OTHER HUGE problem:
Guys, my computer is going crazy, because when i start it up, it plays random music that i DO NOT HAVE on my computer, one moment it played some country music, the next its playing the thong song by sisco!! i cannot belive what is going on. no this is not some sick joke this is totally true and i need help deciding wtf is going on.
maybe it had sex with my dell pc and caught a dtd. HELP ME!!!!
d(^_^)b

item.description:
@Sensored3 wrote:

www.trendmicro.com

HouseCall

Lassen Sie nicht zu, dass Ihr System infiziert wird. Entdecken und entfernen Sie Malware, Würmer, Spyware und andere bösartige Bedrohungen kostenlos. Starten Sie Ihren kostenlosen Scan – es ist ganz einfach.


just let that scan everything over.

item.title: Tell me wtf is up with my pc!
item.dc:creator: @nator123123 nator123123
item.description:
@nator123123 wrote:

Sorry dude. Viruses like these are hard to stop. I have to say you have to format your computer, or get Kaspersky or NOD32 and clear them out.

PS: DON’T GET BOTH KASPERSKY AND NOD32, OR YOU’LL HAVE ANOTHER PROBLEM YOUR WAY.

Read full topic

item.title: Tell me wtf is up with my pc!
item.dc:creator: @dark_child dark_child
item.description:
@dark_child wrote:

[quote=“akisboy32, post:1, topic:131624”]if that only happens when your connected to the internet then your computer Has Trojan and theres some other viruses , my best advice for you is to format your computer and then add a new Anti-Virus system , because if you dont do this it will make a bigger problems to you and may Harm your harddrive, Then you would have to throw your pc of the window cause it would have no use .[/quote]you dont know what you’re talking about do you

its probably that email hacking, i advise you look further into this and there may be tutorial on how to fix it

item.description:
@Mattymat1313 wrote:

0_o that video ddnt solve my problem but i saw that icon that dude had and it was similar to mines, his was about his firewall and security, and mines was about my computer’s security could be introuble from harmful program. But that video might of helped me in a way to fixing my gaming computer. so thanks in one way ^___^

item.source: Tell me wtf is up with my pc!

item.title: Tell me wtf is up with my pc!
item.dc:creator: @3.65_kilos 3.65 kilos
item.description:
@3.65_kilos wrote:

Not sure. I don’t have a password set my computer either and have never had pa problem like that. I do know that one way they could’ve got control of your system is through email. (Here’s a video I saw about it. Not the exact same thing, but the same principle.)

I could always be wrong…which I probably am.

Read full topic
item.source: Tell me wtf is up with my pc!

item.title: Tell me wtf is up with my pc!
item.dc:creator: @Mattymat1313 Mattymat1313
item.description:
@Mattymat1313 wrote:

3.65 kilos:

I’d say it is VERY possible that someone has control of your system via internet. (When you turn on your computer, they can control it from their computer). Not sure how you fix that though…

probably i can use spyware removal tool, that is wierd though cause the only thing i have “on the network” is my shared files in a folder. i never set a password for my computer, could this be a problem??

EDIT: well my harddrive was on shared also and ima watch that video and see.

Read full topic

item.title: Tell me wtf is up with my pc!
item.dc:creator: @Mattymat1313 Mattymat1313
item.description:
@Mattymat1313 wrote:

os windows 2k. and kilos that is just wierd 0_o. and with internet unplugged these things dont happen, also i recieve random popups about this “WINDOWS INTERNET EXPLORER KEEPS TRACK OF ALL THE ADULT SITES YOU HAVE VISITED” and i dont watch porn. WTf???

EDIT: and this active X control thingy keeps popping up T_T without my permission. its like someone has remote control over my pc. the only time i can install stuff is probably during safe mode because safe mode only loads the basic windows things. i’ve looked at my processes with task manager and havent found anything suspicious at all.

Read full topic
item.source: Tell me wtf is up with my pc!

item.title: Tell me wtf is up with my pc!
item.dc:creator: @3.65_kilos 3.65 kilos
item.description:
@3.65_kilos wrote:

Unplug your internet and play around with your computer. Tell us if it’s still doing weird things. (Oh, and the music thing is in your speakers, I think. I have some really old speakers that pick up radio stations unintentionally. It’s creepy.)

Read full topic
